answers.answer: The rest of us here have discovered ours was linked with Anxiety.Anxiety can cause a lot of physical changes.  I'm sure you've heard of people who worry so much that they make themselves physically sick?Well this is similar.  The problem is, sometimes with an anxiety disorder, you don't know that you are worrying about anything.What you should try doing, is 1) go to an eye doctor.  If they don't find anything, then maybe you could try visiting your local Mental Health Clinic and talking to a psychiatrist.You can talk to them and they can tell you what they think.In the mean time, practice relaxation techniques.  Even just evaluating what it is you *might* be worrying about could help you.If stress gets to you, then you can try taking a yoga class, or just practice meditation techniques.  I also know of some teas that can help you relax.

This is a disorder of the cranial nerves, which control ocular movement.The most comon etiology is not anxiety, but a palsy secondary to an insulin utilization problem - generally diabetes. In other words this may be a varient of diabetic neuropathy.You need a consult from an opthamalogical neurologist, as well as an hba1c test (red blood cells) for diabetes and preferably a glucose fasting protocol or an insulin clamp orotocol.There are other reasosn for a palsy of these nerves, including infection and tumors, so it's best to get it checked.
Have you had any imaging done?  CT?  MRI?Recentl Labs done?Ophthalmologist visit?
Thankyou for all the feedback, I havn't had anything ehcekd out yet but I will do very soon

question: Hello, for the past 7 months my vision has been really strange, when I look around and then stop it takes a while to adjust to focus.. my head also feels really stange, its hard to explain.. it feels pressured but just not right. this has been constantly like this for 7 months and I am very worried. Its hard to concentrate on things aswell and my memory isnt great..Does anything know what this could be?? and what can help?
title: Blurred vision weird head feeling
